4801.definition: [συζεύγνυμι] from {{G4862}} and the base of {{G2201}}; to yoke together, i.e. (figuratively) conjoin (in marriage)

4802.definition: [συζητέω] from {{G4862}} and {{G2212}}; to investigate jointly, i.e. discuss, controvert, cavil

4805.definition: [σύζυγος] from {{G4801}}; co-yoked, i.e. (figuratively) as noun, a colleague; probably rather as a proper name; Syzygus, a Christian

4806.definition: [συζωοποιέω] from {{G4862}} and {{G2227}}; to reanimate conjointly with (figuratively)

4807.definition: [συκάμινος] of Hebrew origin ({{H8256}}) in imitation of {{G4809}}; a sycamore-fig tree

4809.definition: [συκομωραία] from {{G4810}} and μόρον (the mulberry); the "sycamore"-fig tree Compare {{G4807}}.

4810.definition: [σῦκον] apparently a primary word; a fig

4811.definition: [συκοφαντέω] from a compound of {{G4810}} and a derivative of {{G5316}}; to be a fig-informer (reporter of the law forbidding the exportation of figs from Greece), "sycophant", i.e. (genitive and by extension) to defraud (exact unlawfully, extort)

4812.definition: [συλαγωγέω] from the base of {{G4813}} and (the reduplicated form of) {{G71}}; to lead away as booty, i.e. (figuratively) seduce

4813.definition: [συλάω] from a derivative of σύλλω (to strip; probably akin to {{G138}}; compare {{G4661}}); to despoil

4814.definition: [συλλαλέω] from {{G4862}} and {{G2980}}; to talk together, i.e. converse

4815.definition: [συλλαμβάνω] from {{G4862}} and {{G2983}}; to clasp, i.e. seize (arrest, capture); specially, to conceive (literally or figuratively); by implication, to aid

4816.definition: [συλλέγω] from {{G4862}} and {{G3004}} in its original sense; to collect

4817.definition: [συλλογίζομαι] from {{G4862}} and {{G3049}}; to reckon together (with oneself), i.e. deliberate

4818.definition: [συλλυπέω] from {{G4862}} and {{G3076}}; to afflict jointly, i.e. (passive) sorrow at (on account of) someone

4819.definition: [συμβαίνω] from {{G4862}} and the base of {{G939}}; to walk (figuratively, transpire) together, i.e. concur (take place)

4820.definition: [συμβάλλω] from {{G4862}} and {{G906}}; to combine, i.e. (in speaking) to converse, consult, dispute, (mentally) to consider, (by implication) to aid, (personally) to join, attack

4822.definition: [συμβιβάζω] from {{G4862}} and βιβάζω (to force; causative (by reduplication) of the base of {{G939}}); to drive together, i.e. unite (in association or affection), (mentally) to infer, show, teach

4823.definition: [συμβουλεύω] from {{G4862}} and {{G1011}}; to give (or take) advice jointly, i.e. recommend, deliberate or determine

4824.definition: [συμβούλιον] neuter of a presumed derivative of {{G4825}}; advisement; specially, a deliberative body, i.e. the provincial assessors or lay-court

4825.definition: [σύμβουλος] from {{G4862}} and {{G1012}}; a consultor, i.e. adviser

4826.definition: [Συμεών] from the same as {{G4613}}; Symeon (i.e. Shimon), the name of five Israelites

4827.definition: [συμμαθητής] from a compound of {{G4862}} and {{G3129}}; a co-learner (of Christianity)

4828.definition: [συμμαρτυρέω] from {{G4862}} and {{G3140}}; to testify jointly, i.e. corroborate by (concurrent) evidence

4829.definition: [συμμερίζομαι] middle voice from {{G4862}} and {{G3307}}; to share jointly, i.e. participate in

4831.definition: [συμμιμητής] from a presumed compound of {{G4862}} and {{G3401}}; a co-imitator, i.e. fellow votary

4832.definition: [σύμμορφος] from {{G4862}} and {{G3444}}; jointly formed, i.e. (figuratively) similar

4833.definition: [συμμορφόω] from {{G4832}}; to render like, i.e. (figuratively) to assimilate

4834.definition: [συμπαθέω] from {{G4835}}; to feel "sympathy" with, i.e. (by implication) to commiserate

4835.definition: [συμπαθής] from {{G4841}}; having a fellow-feeling ("sympathetic"), i.e. (by implication) mutually commiserative

4836.definition: [συμπαραγίνομαι] from {{G4862}} and {{G3854}}; to be present together, i.e. to convene; by implication, to appear in aid

4838.definition: [συμπαραλαμβάνω] from {{G4862}} and {{G3880}}; to take along in company

4839.definition: [συμπαραμένω] from {{G4862}} and {{G3887}}; to remain in company, i.e. still live

4840.definition: [συμπάρειμι] from {{G4862}} and {{G3918}}; to be at hand together, i.e. now present

4841.definition: [συμπάσχω] from {{G4862}} and {{G3958}} (including its alternate); to experience pain jointly or of the same kind (specially, persecution; to "sympathize")

4842.definition: [συμπέμπω] from {{G4862}} and {{G3992}}; to despatch in company

4843.definition: [συμπεριλαμβάνω] from {{G4862}} and a compound of {{G4012}} and {{G2983}}; to take by enclosing altogether, i.e. earnestly throw the arms about one

4844.definition: [συμπίνω] from {{G4862}} and {{G4095}}; to partake a beverage in company

4845.definition: [συμπληρόω] from {{G4862}} and {{G4137}}; to implenish completely, i.e. (of space) to swamp (a boat), or (of time) to accomplish (passive, be complete)

4846.definition: [συμπνίγω] from {{G4862}} and {{G4155}}; to strangle completely, i.e. (literally) to drown, or (figuratively) to crowd

4847.definition: [συμπολίτης] from {{G4862}} and {{G4177}}; a native of the same town, i.e. (figuratively) co-religionist (fellow-Christian)

4848.definition: [συμπορεύομαι] from {{G4862}} and {{G4198}}; to journey together; by implication, to assemble

4849.definition: [συμπόσιον] neuter of a derivative of the alternate of {{G4844}}; a drinking-party ("symposium"), i.e. (by extension) a room of guests

4851.definition: [συμφέρω] from {{G4862}} and {{G5342}} (including its alternate); to bear together (contribute), i.e. (literally) to collect, or (figuratively) to conduce; especially (neuter participle as a noun) advantage

4852.definition: [σύμφημι] from {{G4862}} and {{G5346}}; to say jointly, i.e. assent to

4853.definition: [συμφυλέτης] from {{G4862}} and a derivative of {{G5443}}; a co-tribesman, i.e. native of the same country

4854.definition: [σύμφυτος] from {{G4862}} and a derivative of {{G5453}}; grown along with (connate), i.e. (figuratively) closely united to

4855.definition: [συμφύω] from {{G4862}} and {{G5453}}; passive, to grow jointly

4856.definition: [συμφωνέω] from {{G4859}}; to be harmonious, i.e. (figuratively) to accord (be suitable, concur) or stipulate (by compact)

4858.definition: [συμφωνία] from {{G4859}}; unison of sound ("symphony"), i.e. a concert of instruments (harmonious note)

4859.definition: [σύμφωνος] from {{G4862}} and {{G5456}}; sounding together (alike), i.e. (figuratively) accordant (neuter as noun, agreement)

4861.definition: [σύμψυχος] from {{G4862}} and {{G5590}}; co-spirited, i.e. similar in sentiment

4862.definition: [σύν] a primary preposition denoting union; with or together (but much closer than {{G3326}} or {{G3844}}), i.e. by association, companionship, process, resemblance, possession, instrumentality, addition, etc. In composition it has similar applications, including completeness.

4863.definition: [συνάγω] from {{G4862}} and {{G71}}; to lead together, i.e. collect or convene; specially, to entertain (hospitably)

4864.definition: [συναγωγή] from (the reduplicated form of) {{G4863}}; an assemblage of persons; specially, a Jewish "synagogue" (the meeting or the place); by analogy, a Christian church

4865.definition: [συναγωνίζομαι] from {{G4862}} and {{G75}}; to struggle in company with, i.e. (figuratively) to be a partner (assistant)

4866.definition: [συναθλέω] from {{G4862}} and {{G118}}; to wrestle in company with, i.e. (figuratively) to seek jointly

4867.definition: [συναθροίζω] from {{G4862}} and ἀθροίζω (to hoard); to convene

4868.definition: [συναίρω] from {{G4862}} and {{G142}}; to make up together, i.e. (figuratively) to compute (an account)

4871.definition: [συναλίζω] from {{G4862}} and ἁλίζω (to throng); to accumulate, i.e. convene

4872.definition: [συναναβαίνω] from {{G4862}} and {{G305}}; to ascend in company with

4873.definition: [συνανάκειμαι] from {{G4862}} and {{G345}}; to recline in company with (at a meal)

4874.definition: [συναναμίγνυμι] from {{G4862}} and a compound of {{G303}} and {{G3396}}; to mix up together, i.e. (figurative) associate with

4875.definition: [συναναπαύομαι] middle from {{G4862}} and {{G373}}; to recruit oneself in company with

4876.definition: [συναντάω] from {{G4862}} and a derivative of {{G473}}; to meet with; figuratively, to occur

4878.definition: [συναντιλαμβάνομαι] from {{G4862}} and {{G482}}; to take hold of opposite together, i.e. co-operate (assist)

4879.definition: [συναπάγω] from {{G4862}} and {{G520}}; to take off together, i.e. transport with (seduce, passively, yield)

4880.definition: [συναποθνήσκω] from {{G4862}} and {{G599}}; to decease (literally) in company with, or (figuratively), similarly to

4881.definition: [συναπόλλυμι] from {{G4862}} and {{G622}}; to destroy (middle voice or passively, be slain) in company with

4882.definition: [συναποστέλλω] from {{G4862}} and {{G649}}; to despatch (on an errand) in company with

4883.definition: [συναρμολογέω] from {{G4862}} and a derivative of a compound of {{G719}} and {{G3004}} (in its original sense of laying); to render close-jointed together, i.e. organize compactly

4884.definition: [συναρπάζω] from {{G4862}} and {{G726}}; to snatch together, i.e. seize

4885.definition: [συναυξάνω] from {{G4862}} and {{G837}}; to increase (grow up) together

4886.definition: [σύνδεσμος] from {{G4862}} and {{G1199}}; a joint tie, i.e. ligament, (figuratively) uniting principle, control

4887.definition: [συνδέω] from {{G4862}} and {{G1210}}; to bind with, i.e. (passively) be a fellow-prisoner (figuratively)

4888.definition: [συνδοξάζω] from {{G4862}} and {{G1392}}; to exalt to dignity in company (i.e. similarly) with

4889.definition: [σύνδουλος] from {{G4862}} and {{G1401}}; a co-slave, i.e. servitor or ministrant of the same master (human or divine)

4890.definition: [συνδρομή] from (the alternate of) {{G4936}}; a running together, i.e. (riotous) concourse

4891.definition: [συνεγείρω] from {{G4862}} and {{G1453}}; to rouse (from death) in company with, i.e. (figuratively) to revivify (spirtually) in resemblance to

4892.definition: [συνέδριον] neuter of a presumed derivative of a compound of {{G4862}} and the base of {{G1476}}; a joint session, i.e. (specially), the Jewish Sanhedrin; by analogy, a subordinate tribunal

4893.definition: [συνείδησις] from a prolonged form of {{G4894}}; co-perception, i.e. moral consciousness

4894.definition: [συνείδω] from {{G4862}} and {{G1492}}; to see completely; used (like its primary) only in two past tenses, respectively meaning to understand or become aware, and to be conscious or (clandestinely) informed of

4895.definition: [σύνειμι] from {{G4862}} and {{G1510}} (including its various inflections); to be in company with, i.e. present at the time

4896.definition: [σύνειμι] from {{G4862}} and εἶμι (to go); to assemble

4897.definition: [συνεισέρχομαι] from {{G4862}} and {{G1525}}; to enter in company with

4898.definition: [συνέκδημος] from {{G4862}} and the base of {{G1553}}; a co-absentee from home, i.e. fellow-traveller

4899.definition: [συνεκλεκτός] from a compound of {{G4862}} and {{G1586}}; chosen in company with, i.e. co-elect (fellow Christian)

4900.definition: [συνελαύνω] from {{G4862}} and {{G1643}}; to drive together, i.e. (figuratively) exhort (to reconciliation)
